summary: This is an email chain from August 25, 2023, between FBI personnel discussing the search for a government witness who previously testified as a metadata expert in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is seeking this person to serve as an expert in the FTX case. The emails confirm that the witness did testify regarding metadata in the Maxwell case, but the court did not allow him to give expert opinion testimony under Rule 702.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; her criminal case is referenced as the source of a potential expert witness for the FTX case.

events.title: Testimony in Maxwell Case
events.description: A government witness testified regarding metadata in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, but the court did not allow him to give opinion testimony as an expert under Federal Rule of Evidence 702.

events.title: Email Inquiry for FTX Case
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails to identify a metadata expert who testified in the Maxwell case, as the SDNY seeks to use the same person as an expert in the FTX case.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is seeking a government witness who previously testified as a metadata expert in the Ghislaine Maxwell case to serve as an expert in the FTX case.
The witness in question did testify regarding metadata in the Maxwell case, but the court ruled he could not give expert opinion testimony under Federal Rule of Evidence 702.
The email chain is a 2023 internal FBI communication discussing case precedent and witness history between the Maxwell and FTX cases.
The correspondence highlights procedural and evidentiary challenges from the Maxwell case being reviewed for application in a separate, contemporary case (FTX).
